label: 賢所
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: Also called the Naishidokoro. A room or building that was part of the Ummei-den, in which was kept the replica of The Mirror (Yata-no-kagami) used by the Sovereign (Tennō) as one of the Three Imperial Regalia (Sanju-no-shinki ). [内侍所、温明殿、八咫鏡、天皇、三種神器]
